page.title: 09IDSWORTH (CONT)
page.content:
{ Idsworth House (New Site)}
This Victorian house was built in 1850 for Sir Jervoise Clarke_Jervoise by the railway company because they had put the line very close to his old house. Recently the estate was sold and the house and outhouses were converted into smaller homes. The best rooms of the original house are still in one home _ the music room,games room,dining room,sitting room,gunroom and library. Upstairs there are many bedrooms and bathrooms. There is an impressive front door and a side door through which the servants took the baggage. Another home was the servants' section. It contains a passage with 45 bells.
